FXML (Flash XML) is a mark up language for the Flash / ActionScript language. Similar to MXML: properties, functions, and even complex object types can be represented through XML. The major difference is that with FXML, objects are created at runtime as opposed to compile time. This feature allows for rapid development along with code that is easy to read and update! With FXML, any developer can make adjustments to the code. Small changes such as element positioning, application configurations, text updates, and more can now be done by front-end web developers taking the burden off of the flash developer. FXML can also help with integration into large scale projects as application developers will have more control over dependencies and can easily adjust the application accordingly.

FXML was created and is maintained by Jordan Doczy www.jordandoczy.com
